title: LD50 Dose of Lead in Rats

content.description: The following graph shows the dose-response relationship of tetramethyl lead in rats.
content.question: Which of the following approaches should be used to calculate the amount of lead, in milligrams, that would be present in a population of 200 rats with each rat weighing on average 20 grams, dosed with the <math alttext="L D 50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD</mtext><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dose.

choices.label: <math alttext="200 rats times the fraction 20 grams over 1 rat, times the fraction 1 kilogram over 1000 grams, times the fraction 150 milligrams over 1 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>rats</mtext><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>rat</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
